website_summaries.verdict: A premium DSLR camera that can use the entire range of Nikon's high-end lenses or budget Nikkor options.
pros: Bluetooth connectivity makes it easy to control the camera from a smartphone or tablet
The controls are easy to learn for first-time photographers mastering the basics
cons: The lack of built-in image stabilization makes it harder to take clear pictures without a tripod

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of walking and have lugged about heavy, professional Nikon full frame dslr's. I needed a lighter, more compact camera and this model fits the bill perfectly. The picture quality easily matches that of my 'professional' cameras. It may not be as robust as my other cameras, but I don't tend to misuse my cameras. Having said that, this camera, although very light, feels extremely well made and was an absolute bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pigeon
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and simple to use. Very happy with the quality of the pictures. Bought a couple extra batteries (with a separate charger), camera bag and memory card. Perfect for new starters, this camera was also highly recommended by Which.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Stonebank

customer_reviews.title: No charger for UK plug, no English Instruction and I have to drive miles
customer_reviews.text: Bought in good faith for my holiday. Arrived but no UK plug to charge battery & no English instructions BEWARE you do not get an immediate refund!! Now I have to drive miles & take it to a Hermes delivery point, very poor service. Closing my amazon prime account immediately & hope not to use Amazon again - very very upset by this.
customer_reviews.author: studentinahurry
